item.title: Global Government and Global Opposition
item.description: Strange, Susan. “Global Government and Global Opposition.” In Politics in an Interdependent World, Geraint Parry, editor. 20-33. Aldershot: Edward Elgar Publishers, 1994. After recognising the relevance of discussions of a ‘new medievalism’ in the global political economy Strange suggests that the best way of addressing the nature and use of power is her structural model. She suggests that the deterriotrialisation of power and the increasing importance of ‘diplomacy’ between firms as laid out in Rival States, Rival Firms (with John M.
